content.description: Climb up the slab, following your nose for the line of least resistance while also keeping an eye out for gear placements. I had a hard time finding much for protection on this until the very top but it's pretty casual.
content.protection: Standard rack of nuts and cams. Two bolt anchor at top.
content.location: On the far left of the Right Formation, slightly separate from the main buttress of the Right Formation is a shorter, low angled slab. You can also access the two bolt anchor by scrambling around the left side.

content.description:
Camouflaged, runout bolts though suspect rock and otherwise fantastic climbing. Chain anchors are set back awkwardly making rappelling off mandatory to avoid heavy rope grind. As you rappel, unclip rope from draws- otherwise pulling the rope will be extremely difficult.

It would be injurious to fall at 4th bolt (and a few other spots); avoid this route unless very comfortable at the grade and experienced with lower rock quality.
content.location: From Cape Fear (10b on Left Formation), turn around and walk down and left around the corner. An overhanging shelf 8 feet high has two routes: a mixed trad/sport route on left side and this climb on right side.
